common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services fails to open due to WebSocket connection failure
common_issues.description: Multiple users are unable to open Pieces Core Services.  A WebSocketException occurs with a 404 error when attempting to connect to 'http://127.0.0.1:39300/user/last_checked_in/stream#'. The PiecesOS version is unknown. This issue appears on macOS 15.5 with an Apple M2 processor.  Further investigation into the server-side or network configuration is needed.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Core Services
related_issues.text:

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Stability and Feature Issues Across Platforms
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various issues with Pieces OS, including Long-Term Memory unavailability on Linux despite official confirmation, crashes on Windows when moving the application window or scrolling, and "WebSocketException" errors preventing Pieces Core Services from opening on MacOS.  These issues span different Pieces OS versions and underlying operating systems, suggesting potential broader software stability and feature implementation problems.

related_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
related_issues.text:
Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

### Description
I'm experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory feature on Linux. While the Discord team has confirmed that this feature should be available on Linux, the Pieces OS interface explicitly shows that the feature is not available for Linux systems.

### Current Behavior
- Pieces OS shows a message indicating Long-Term Memory is not available for Linux
- Long-Term Memory functionality does not work on the Linux platform
- Other operating systems appear to have this feature working correctly

### Expected Behavior
- Long-Term Memory feature should be available and functional on Linux, as confirmed by the Discord team

### Evidence
- [Discord communication confirming feature availability](https://discord.com/channels/1098986658851999776/1320479548797882430/1320643614443048971)

- ![Screenshot showing Pieces OS message about feature unavailability on Linux](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ca6cb2d0-ef52-4194-bd57-c8a84be2d0db)



### Questions
1. When can Linux users expect this feature to be fully available?
2. Is there a planned timeline for Linux support?
3. Are there any workarounds available in the meantime?

### System Information
- Operating System: Linux [Zorin OS 17.2 based on Linux 6.8.0-50-generic~22.04.1-Ubuntu]
- Pieces OS Version: [PiecesOS 11.0.3]
- Desktop App: [Pieces for Developers 3.3.2]

### Additional Notes
This feature is currently working on other operating systems, and Linux users would greatly benefit from having access to this functionality.

related_issues.title: Crash when scrolling or moving a window to another screen
related_issues.text:
Crash when scrolling or moving a window to another screen
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS 12.0.0, Pieces for Developers 4.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I don't know how to provide more info.
Every time I move the app on my left screen, it crashes. Oftentimes when I scroll the chats list or the chat itself, it crashes, too.

recommendations: Investigate the root cause of the WebSocketException preventing Pieces Core Services from opening. This appears to be the most frequent and impactful issue across multiple macOS users.
Address the stability issues on Windows causing crashes when moving the application window or scrolling.
Clarify the availability of Long-Term Memory on Linux and ensure the feature is working as expected.
Gather more detailed information from users experiencing issues, including Pieces OS version and specific steps to reproduce the problems.
Improve error messaging and logging to provide more context for troubleshooting and resolution.
